poem:
**Digital Leaves**  
  
In the webbed blur  
of relentless scroll,  
a woman learns—  
the feed whispers  
her secret swollen state,  
  
algorithms spin  
infant phantoms  
uninvited,  
  
her husband,  
unmarked by  
the unerring  
buzz of  
targeted blooms,  
  
while she navigates  
this electric garden  
alone,  
unplugged,  
overgrown.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How social media tries to exploit your pregnancy | Letters I am so glad to see an article published about the impact of social media on pregnant people and new mothers (‘I felt doomed’: social media guessed I was pregnant – and my feed soon grew horrifying, 3 September). I say “mothers” as I noticed my husband was not subjected to the same algorithms that I was. I, too, found it completely overwhelming when I was". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
